title: East Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire breaking news - BBC News
summary: hymers college in lockdown after police operation in the area .
three hurt , including two children , after coach and lorry collide .
man dies after getting trapped between car and garage door .
voting under way as polls open in general election .
last drive starts for hull city of culture 2017 volunteers .

documents.title: clinical hull fc in big win at salford
text: clinical hull fc in big win at salford

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me today , but before i go , here are five things we did n't know when we woke up this morning :
author: Suzy Lawson
Broadcast Journalist

documents.title: watch : peter levy with tonight 's look north headlines
text: tonight 's headlines with @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: two east yorkshire men jailed for being drunk on a plane
text: two men from east yorkshire have been sentenced at sheffield crown court after they were found to be drunk and verbally abusive towards passengers on a flight bound for doncaster/sheffield airport .
27-year-old andris vagals , of barmby road in pocklington , york and juris terentjevs ( below ) , aged 30 of fifth avenue in goole were on a flight from riga in latvia in january .

terentjevs was jailed for 12 months for endangering a person on an aircraft and being drunk on an aircraft , while vagals was handed a four month sentence , suspended for 12 months , with 120 hours of unpaid work for being drunk on an aircraft .

documents.title: update : hymers college pupils can go home
text: pupils at hymers college in hull have been allowed to go home , after the school was in 'lock down ' for more than two hours .
the school says it kept the children inside on the advice of the police , following a reported theft in the area earlier .
1 of 2 the pupils have now been released to go home .
any pupils remaining on site , both junior and senior , should be collected from the lrc .

documents.title: hymers college remains in `` lock down ''
text: hymers college in hull remains in `` lock down , '' according to a tweet from the school .
it says the children are safely locked inside , on the advice of the police , following a reported theft in the spring bank area earlier .
collection arrangements for 7c and 7d as normal at the bus bays .
the school is back in lock down following police advice .
all of the children are safe in locked buildings .
sending # emmaus thoughts - keep safe all

documents.title: weather : showers clearing , but more on the way
text: any lingering showers this evening will ease , with clear spells developing .
however , further showers will start to push in from the west through the second half of the night .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: hopes for memorial for hull rugby league legend
text: the hull fc coach lee radford says the club is hoping to created a permanent memorial to the late arthur bunting .
the former black and whites coach , who led the team to nearly every trophy and major final in the late 1970s and 1980s , has died at the age of 80 .
players will also wear black armbands for their game at salford tomorrow as a mark of respect .
author: Matt Dean
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: tour of britain route updated
text: the route for the tour of britain cycling race in north lincolnshire has been updated .
north lincolnshire council says stage three of the national event will take place in the area on tuesday 5 september , covering 172 km of the local countryside .
the race will start at normanby hall country park and will cover the isle of axholme , brigg and barton , before the big finish near central park in scunthorpe .

documents.title: police update after hymers college in 'lockdown '
text: humberside police say they were called to the spring bank area of hull following reports of a nearby theft .
officers carried out a search of the school as part of the investigation .
they say all staff and students are safe , and they were kept indoors for a short time as a precaution .

documents.title: school coach crashes injuring three
text: school coach crashes injuring three

documents.title: would you open your home to a homeless teenager ?
text: one of the young people helped by a charity for teenagers at risk of becoming homeless in our area says he now has `` a brighter future . ''
safe and sound homes , known as sash , is appealing for more people in the hull area to consider offering a spare room to a young person in need .
nathan , who is 17-years-old , was given a place to stay in bridlington through the charity , following difficulties with his family .
he said it has helped him turn things around :
it 's great .
i feel like part of the family , they 've welcomed me in .
i 've got a much brighter future ''
author: Phillip Norton
BBC News

documents.title: breakingupdate : wolfreton school evacuation
text: humberside police has given an update following reports that wolferton school in east yorkshire has been evacuated .
it says officers are at the site after what is believed to be a hoax bomb threat .
the force says the school has been evacuated as a precaution and a search of the school and grounds is ongoing , however it is thought to be a hoax threat made by a local youth .

documents.title: breakinghymers college allclear after in 'lockdown '
text: hymers college in hull says the school was in lockdown following reports of an intruder on site :
we have now received an 'all clear ' from humberside police the end of school will be as normal 2/2
is this still the case ?
i am glad everything and everyone is ok .
scary world .
there are reports of an intruder on site .
we are working with the police .
the school is in lockdown , all the children are safe .
still on lock down
if the school is in `` lockdown '' presumably , the kids ca n't escape .

documents.title: breakingwolfreton school in east yorkshire evacuated
text: humberside fire and rescue say wolfreton school in kirkella has been evacuated .
we 'll bring you more information as we get it .

documents.title: weather : more rain and some bright spells
text: it was a pretty miserable morning , and there 's more rain on the way i 'm afraid .
we should see some brighter spells though :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: car fails to stop after hitting woman in withernsea
text: a woman has been injured in withernsea after a car mounted the kerb and hit her .
the 51-year-old suffered minor leg injuries in the incident on queen street on wednesday 31 may , but the driver of the car failed to stop .
police want to speak to anyone who was in the area at the time .

documents.title: road re-opens following coach crash
text: the a614 at kirkburn near driffied has re-opened following a crash involving a school coach and a lorry earlier .
a man and two children suffered minor injuries in the collision .
author: Sarah Walton
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: workshops for city of culture poetry project
text: local poets are helping people in hull bring their city of culture 2017 poems to life .
landlines is a bbc radio humberside project which asks people to send in a short poem about where they live with the aim of collecting a total of 2,017 poems as part of an art installation .
poets dean wilson and vicky foster are visiting libraries to help people create their submissions .
the workshops will take place at hedon library on saturday 10 june and north bridlington library on saturday 17 june .
author: Carl Wheatley
Presenter, BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: skateboarders make hull their hq
text: remember earlier this year when it was announced that hull would become a national centre for skateboarding and a `` skate friendly destination '' ?
hull city council said it wanted to make the city a centre of excellence for the sport by improving facilities and encouraging more young people to take up skating .
now a professional skateboarder and former tv personality is to open a new skate shop in hull .
lee dainton , from the mtv stunt programme dirty sanchez , is one of those behind the project , which will also have its own amateur and professional teams .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from our hull newsroom so far today include :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside News

documents.title: watch : coming up this week in the city of culture
text: here 's kofi smiles with his latest update on what 's going on in the city of culture this week :
author: Hull 2017: UK City of Culture

documents.title: man dies after getting trapped between car and garage door
text: a 72-year-old man has died after becoming trapped between a car and a garage door in belton , north lincolnshire .
the emergency services were called to a property on westgate road at about 12:20 on wednesday afternoon .
the man , who has n't been named by police , was pronounced dead at the scene .
police are asking anyone who saw what happened to get in touch .

documents.title: children moved from the scene of kirkburn coach crash
text: more from the police following the collision between a school coach and a lorry on the a614 earlier this morning which saw two children and one man injured , though not seriously .
the emergency services have been working to safely transport the children who were travelling on the coach involved in the crash away from the scene , police say .
the a614 remains closed to allow for the recovery of the coach and lorry .

documents.title: buses diverted following school coach crash
text: more on the collision between a bus carrying schoolchildren and a lorry near kirkburn in east yorkshire .
eyms buses have tweeted to say they 're diverting their vehicles following the incident on the a164 :
the rd on a614 at kilburn is closed .
we 're diverting through kilburn on main st & eastlands rd upto tibthorpe , b1248 back to normal # now
no such place as kilburn , it 's kirkburn

documents.title: breakingschool coach in collision with lorry in east yorkshire
text: a coach carrying primary school children has been involved in a crash with a lorry in east yorkshire .
a man and two children were injured in the collision on the a614 near to kirkburn at about 10:00 this morning , according to police .
their injuries are not thought to be serious .
the road is currently closed and drivers are being advised to avoid the area .

documents.title: calls for volunteers to help homeless youngsters in hull
text: a charity which helps to keep young people from living on the streets says it 's desperate for more volunteers in the hull area .
safe and sound homes , known as sash , works to prevent homelessness by providing emergency overnight accommodation for young people .
the charity says it needs more people to offer rooms for the night across hull .
author: Suzy Lawson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the latest stories from our hull newsroom so far this morning include :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside News

documents.title: weather : abbie dewhurst has your forecast
text: weather : abbie dewhurst has your forecast
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: last drive for city of culture volunteers
text: they have become a familiar sight in hull city centre and at all the city of culture events , dressed in their recognisable blue and purple jackets .
thousands of people have already signed up to be city of culture volunteers , and today the final wave of people will be recruited to help out for the second half of the year .
an event is taking place at the prospect shopping centre for those hoping to get involved .

documents.title: polling stations are open
text: voting is under way across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire in the general election .
polling stations across the region opened at 07:00 and will close tonight at 22:00 .
the first results nationally will be announced before midnight , but most constituencies will declare in the early hours of friday morning .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : definitely an umbrella day
text: it 's a cloudy start , with some outbreaks of rain which will become heavier and more persistent through the morning .
we should see some brighter spells later on , but there will be more rain on the way .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to our live coverage on thursday 8 june .
i 'm suzy and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the area throughout the day .
if you want to get in touch you can .
just send me an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
send me your or any news or info about what 's happening where you are .
author: Suzy Lawson
Broadcast Journalist
